item.description:
Seventh Aspire Speaker Series on Asian American Women and STEM Programs Science, Technology, Engineering, and Mathematics

Event Details:
Free and open to the public
6:00PM - 8:00PM, Wednesday, August 15
Microsoft New England Research & Development (NERD) Center
1 Memorial Drive
Cambridge, MA 02142

RSVP: http://aspirestem.eventbrite.com/

The Aspire Speaker Series exposes Asian American women to diverse career professionals, promotes candid conversations about career and personal development, networking, and fosters mentoring relationships between Asian American women. Our target populations for the Speaker Series are Asian American women who are high school students, college students, graduate students, and working professionals.

Speakers: Dr. Connie Chow Executive Director, Science Club for Girls www.scienceclubforgirls.org

Lulu Fan District pharmacy supervisor, CVS Caremark www.caremark.com

Madge M. Meyer State Street Corporation www.statestreet.com

Grace J. Tsau Principal Researcher in the P&G Venus Global Shave Care Products Research Group www.pg.com

Moderator: Christina Xu Founding director, Institute on Higher Awesome Studies Trustee, Boston chapter, Awesome Foundation www.awesomefoundation.org/en/chapters/boston

Event Program:
6:00PM - 6:15PM: Registration and Networking
6:15PM - 7:20PM: Panel discussion
7:20PM - 7:40PM: Q & A
7:40PM - 8:00PM: Evaluation and Networking

7th Aspire Speaker Series on Asian American Women and STEM Programs (Science, Technology, Engineering, Mathematics)

group.name: The Boston Mandarin Chinese Language Meetup Group
